clinical_study.brief_title: Reducing Sedentary Behaviour in University Students Using Text Messages
clinical_study.official_title: Reducing Sedentary Behaviour In University Students Using A Text Message-Based Intervention

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of the current study was to determine whether a text message intervention would increase break frequency and length of break from sitting, time spent standing, and time spent in light and moderate intensity physical activity in university students

detailed_description.textblock: Sedentary behaviour (SB) has been linked to many health problems (e.g., type 2 diabetes, heart disease). Interventions aimed at office workers, overweight and obese individuals have proven successful in reducing SB; however, no studies have examined university students.Text message-based interventions have succeeded to aid in smoking cessation and increase both physical activity and healthy eating, but have not been shown to reduce SB. Eighty-two university students were randomized into intervention (SB related text messages) or control (text messages unrelated to SB) groups. Participants received daily text messages and reported various SBs (i.e., breaks from sitting, standing, light and moderate intensity physical activity) at four time points (baseline, 2, 4 and 6 weeks).

primary_outcome.measure: Change in length of break from sitting in minutes
Change in frequency of break from sitting in minutes
Change in minutes spent in light intensity physical activity
Change in minutes spent in moderate intensity physical activity

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in self-efficacy for sedentary behaviour measured by percentage of confidence
secondary_outcome.description: purpose-built self-efficacy questionnaire used to rate how confident one feels in reducing sedentary behaviour

arm_group.description: text messages related to sedentary behaviour
text messages unrelated to sedentary behaviour.

intervention.intervention_name: text messages related to sedentary behaviour
intervention.description: texts sent twice daily encouraging reduced sedentary behaviour

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- be able to read and write English
- own a cell phone with unlimited incoming text messages
- be a student at Western University
Exclusion Criteria:
- be under 18 or over 64
